medical_history.chief_complaint: Headaches, dizziness, generalized weakness, and witnessed seizure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially presented with one month of headaches, dizziness, and generalized weakness. He experienced an episode of near syncope on the day of presentation. After being discharged from his first hospital visit, he returned 10 days later following a witnessed seizure consisting of upper and lower body tonic-clonic movements at home. At the time of discharge, he did not have any headaches, weakness, or confusion. He had a previously unexplained transitory febrile episode four months before his initial presentation. At his nine-month follow-up visit, his headaches had completely resolved, and he did not have any recurrent seizures while on an anti-seizure regimen of levetiracetam.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a 53-year-old male from Jamaica who frequently travels between Jamaica and his current location.
